short_description: isell, ebcmfsdsup02. purgeexpireddata1, itctm9L1
description:
Job/s in Short description(or below) ended not OK.

Remember to always give us instructions regarding the failed batch jobs.

a) RERUN  Operations Bridge will rerun the batch. If the batch finish ok the depending batch/batches will start, if not ok, Operations Bridge will assign the incident back to the support group.

b) FORCE OK  Operations Bridge set batch status FORCE OK, the failed batch will not run, but depending batch/batches will.

c) HOLD - This status is mostly use to put hold to a cyclic job that continually fails or to put hold to a batch chain.

d) DELETE  Operations Bridge deletes the batch/batches or batch chain. This will not permanently delete the batches from Control-M.
resolution_notes: Resolution notes copied from Parent Incident: job has been started on schedule time. now it is running fine.

short_description: Failed Transport Desk orders still affecting store stock amounts.
description:
A coworker attempted to create a Transport Desk order for a customer. In the process he somehow failed twice (1568904559 and 1568905082) before succeeding (1568905929) (Image: iSell). The succeeded order was later finished normally. However, the only article (50309879) on those orders, was still added to the stocks (Image: Stocks) for even the failed orders. And the reservations for the article were still generated.
It appears that the return tasks for the failed/cancelled orders were generated and are completed and at the same time started (visible in FMS Reverse Receiving, Image: Returns), and MHS/CPS reservations were generated and in paid status (cancelled orders were never paid) (Image: MHS reservations).

Is it possible to reverse the added stocks and purge the unneeded mhs reservations?
FMS Reverse Receiving does seem to allow for continuing receiving, but I am hesitant to try it, since the return status is contradictionary and not a normal return. (Image: Continue Receiving)

I classified the impact as Organization-wide, since the process behavior seems unexpected and might require a fix.

Variables:
-------------
Requested By: Timo Parviainen

Requested For: Timo Parviainen

Keep Informed: Vesa Heikkilä, Ria Helle, Ian Dunkel

Title: Failed Transport Desk orders still affecting store stock amounts.

Description: A coworker attempted to create a Transport Desk order for a customer. In the process he somehow failed twice (1568904559 and 1568905082) before succeeding (1568905929) (Image: iSell). The succeeded order was later finished normally. However, the only article (50309879) on those orders, was still added to the stocks (Image: Stocks) for even the failed orders. And the reservations for the article were still generated.
It appears that the return tasks for the failed/cancelled orders were generated and are completed and at the same time started (visible in FMS Reverse Receiving, Image: Returns), and MHS/CPS reservations were generated and in paid status (cancelled orders were never paid) (Image: MHS reservations).

Is it possible to reverse the added stocks and purge the unneeded mhs reservations?
FMS Reverse Receiving does seem to allow for continuing receiving, but I am hesitant to try it, since the return status is contradictionary and not a normal return. (Image: Continue Receiving)

I classified the impact as Organization-wide, since the process behavior seems unexpected and might require a fix.

Impact: Organization-wide (issue affects many users or locations)

Urgency: Important, but can continue working
resolution_notes:
Failure Point or Cause Code: For the service offering Core MHS, there were hanging reservations that needed to be removed.
Problem Description: Certain articles had expired or invalid reservations that remained active in the system. These hanging reservations were not automatically cleared, causing inconsistencies in the stock records. To prevent issues during inventory processing and stock calculations, the reservations were manually removed from the database.
Impact: The affected articles were incorrectly displayed as "reserved" in the system, resulting in inaccurate stock availability information. This led to potential stock mismatches and could have impacted order fulfillment and inventory operations.
Workaround: Manually removed the hanging reservations by detaching them from the respective articles in the system to restore correct stock visibility and prevent further discrepancies.
Resolution steps taken / Solution / Fix / Preventative action:
1. Logged in to the mentioned store database.
2. Identified the affected reservations and validated their expiry dates.
3. Confirmed reservation validity and source status using ISELL or ISOM.
4. Removed expired or invalid reservations from the item_reservation table.
5. Adjusted the reserved stock values for the affected articles to ensure accuracy.
6. Committed the changes to the system to finalize updates.
7. Verified that the stock availability data was accurate post-adjustment.
Preventive Measures:
1. Implement an automated cleanup job to remove expired or invalid reservations on a scheduled basis.
2. Introduce validation logic to flag hanging reservations before inventory execution.
3. Periodically review the item_reservation table to identify any data inconsistencies.
4. Provide operational training to ensure timely handling of reservation anomalies.
Knowledge Object:For reference, check KB article  KB0030415.
Problem Ticket:There is no active problem ticket for this issue.

short_description: isell,ebcmfsdsup02,purgeexpireddata1,itctm9L1
description:
Job/s in Short description(or below) ended not OK.

Remember to always give us instructions regarding the failed batch jobs.

a) RERUN  Operations Bridge will rerun the batch. If the batch finish ok the depending batch/batches will start, if not ok, Operations Bridge will assign the incident back to the support group.

b) FORCE OK  Operations Bridge set batch status FORCE OK, the failed batch will not run, but depending batch/batches will.

c) HOLD - This status is mostly use to put hold to a cyclic job that continually fails or to put hold to a batch chain.

d) DELETE  Operations Bridge deletes the batch/batches or batch chain. This will not permanently delete the batches from Control-M.
resolution_notes: Resolution notes copied from Parent Incident: job has been started on schedule time. now it is running fine.

c) HOLD - This status is mostly use to put hold to a cyclic job that continually fails or to put hold to a batch chain.

short_description: in ISELL - Delivery / Time Window Issue - Customer Offer
description:
Please see the Variables tab for details

Variables:
-------------
Business services:

in ISELL Service: isell

Please attach a screenshot of the error/error message: pro-qMyGM8zA (1).jpeg

Store Number :: 315

Item numbers (if all provide at least 2 examples) :: professional delivery

Postal code / Zipcode used (if all, provide at least 2 examples): 83000 833980

Delivery type / service type used: all deliveries

Customer type used: Offer

What steps do you normally take and at what point in these steps does the problem occur?: For some time now, I have noticed recurring malfunctions on PRO customer files, especially when we create a SAMS to recreate deliveries or redelivery products.

In concrete terms, several problems arise:

error messages during the creation or processing of SAMS,
inability to make certain deliveries,
deliveries that are not being reported correctly.

This has just alerted me again today: I just tried to deal with a problem following a PRO email and I find myself completely blocked.

I can't return the product through SAMS, and it doesn't work without SAMS, even through ISELL. I suspect the problem is related to the customer's PRO status.
I am therefore wondering if there are currently any updates or interventions underway with PIR, or any other changes, because the situation is really problematic: in some cases, I simply cannot do anything to resolve the cases.


We've noticed that these problems started after the shipping costs changed. However, I want to clarify that it doesn't seem to be directly related to the shipping costs applied to the original order: when I create a return via ISELL, it's no longer linked to the original order, so the problem isn't due to a calculation error or a problem with the shipping costs being applied to the order.

However, it has been observed that these issues primarily affect business customers since the pricing change. The question then arises as to whether there could be an indirect link (configuration, permissions, data flow, etc.) or not.

How many users are affected?: all

How many stores are affected? I don't know.

What is the impact on the business? ?: Inability to resolve professional client cases

Raise your head: true

Gábor

short_description: Orders are appearing in Wait List report but then we cannot process because they are not available to ship.
description:
Orders are appearing in the wait list reports as available but when we try to process them, we get a message that the articles are not connected to a delivery. This in an ongoing problem. The system should be reserving the stock when the orders move into Wait List ready status. We have submitted multiple IT tickets and have been told that the orders are not processing because stock is not available. If stock is not available, then the order should not be appearing in the report.

Variables:
-------------
Requested By: Paula Tucker

Requested For: Paula Tucker

Keep Informed: Brittany Hecker, Heather MacDonald

Title: Orders are appearing in Wait List report but then we cannot process because they are not available to ship. 

Description: Orders are appearing in the wait list reports as available but when we try to process them, we get a message that the articles are not connected to a delivery. This in an ongoing problem. The system should be reserving the stock when the orders move into Wait List ready status. We have submitted multiple IT tickets and have been told that the orders are not processing because stock is not available. If stock is not available, then the order should not be appearing in the report.

Impact: My team (issue affects multiple people I work with)

Urgency: Important, but can continue working
resolution_notes:
Issue: Unable to cancel the order.
- I Sell team informed that they have reviewed the order status and observed that it is marked as cancelled in iSell. Since the order is already cancelled, we are unable to proceed with any further actions related to it.
- Since, the team has confirmed there is no alternative to proceed further.
- Proceeding with closure of ticket as resolved.
- Informing the user on the same.

short_description: Ghost Orders going to fulfillment
description:
Hi  we have received several ghost order emails. As usual, we checked iSell and found no order, while ACI shows the payment was completed. We therefore created a new order and shipped the goods to the customer.

However, some of the customers later informed us that they also received the original ghost order emails. When we checked iSell again, the ghost orders had appeared, were sent to fulfilment and marked as delivered. Could you please investigate and confirm what happened?
Some orders : 1555443034; 1555449884; 1555451078; 1555450676

Look up: true

Catalog item: Other questions

Service: isell

Assignment group: HCL-RM-iSell-SL1

Service offering: iSell EU

Ownership group: Support Team Customer - Sales & Payments

Created for: Andreas Berg
resolution_notes:
Failure Point or Cause Code: For the service offering Core MHS, there were hanging reservations that needed to be removed.
Problem Description: Certain articles had expired or invalid reservations that remained active in the system. These hanging reservations were not automatically cleared, causing inconsistencies in the stock records. To prevent issues during inventory processing and stock calculations, the reservations were manually removed from the database.
Impact: The affected articles were incorrectly displayed as "reserved" in the system, resulting in inaccurate stock availability information. This led to potential stock mismatches and could have impacted order fulfillment and inventory operations.
Workaround: Manually removed the hanging reservations by detaching them from the respective articles in the system to restore correct stock visibility and prevent further discrepancies.
Resolution steps taken / Solution / Fix / Preventative action:
1. Logged in to the mentioned store database.
2. Identified the affected reservations and validated their expiry dates.
3. Confirmed reservation validity and source status using ISELL or ISOM.
4. Removed expired or invalid reservations from the item_reservation table.
5. Adjusted the reserved stock values for the affected articles to ensure accuracy.
6. Committed the changes to the system to finalize updates.
7. Verified that the stock availability data was accurate post-adjustment.
Preventive Measures:
1. Implement an automated cleanup job to remove expired or invalid reservations on a scheduled basis.
2. Introduce validation logic to flag hanging reservations before inventory execution.
3. Periodically review the item_reservation table to identify any data inconsistencies.
4. Provide operational training to ensure timely handling of reservation anomalies.
Knowledge Object:For reference, check KB article  KB0030415.
Problem Ticket:There is no active problem ticket for this issue.

Good day, colleagues.
Unfortunately, we have started encountering a situation where orders are appearing in the Sams report with a deviation stating that the product is unavailable, even though our stock levels show that the product is available in the warehouse. short_description: Duplicate primelineNo
description:
Hi Team,
 
1558120218 for this fullserve order we can see DeliveryNo 4 had persisted when the order is created. Later there was a modification and deliveryNo was changed to 13, but in ISOM console we can see deliveryNo 4 is still in created status instead of cancelled and the items are connected to it.
In this case ideally deliveryNo 4 should be in cancelled status and items should be connected to deliveryNo 13.

Attached modification request kindly verify and let us know what the issue in the payload was and let us know what is expected request for this order. If there is any change in the delivery line like when a new deliveryNo is sent during modification overriding the previous delivery do you expect us to send Action 'cancel' for previously booked delivery??

Title: Old reservation delete iSell 1057194853

resolution_notes:
Failure Point or Cause Code:
Hanging reservations in Core MHS.
Problem Description:
Certain articles had expired or invalid reservations not cleared automatically.
Impact:
Incorrect reserved stock, leading to stock mismatches.
Workaround:
Manually removed hanging reservations.
Resolution steps taken / Solution / Fix / Preventative Action:
1. Logged into store DB.
2. Identified affected reservations.
3. Validated reservation status.
4. Removed invalid reservations.
5. Adjusted reserved stock.
6. Committed changes.
7. Verified stock accuracy.
Preventive Measures:
1. Implement automated cleanup.
2. Add validation logic.
3. Review reservation table periodically.
4. Provide user training.
Knowledge Object:
KB article  KB0030415.
Problem Ticket: No active problem ticket.

resolution_notes:
Failure Point or Cause Code:
Hanging reservations in Core MHS.
Problem Description:
Certain articles had expired or invalid reservations not cleared automatically.
Impact:
Incorrect reserved stock, leading to stock mismatches.
Workaround:
Manually removed hanging reservations.
Resolution steps taken / Solution / Fix / Preventative Action:
1. Logged into store DB.
2. Identified affected reservations.
3. Validated reservation status.
4. Removed invalid reservations.
5. Adjusted reserved stock.
6. Committed changes.
7. Verified stock accuracy.
Preventive Measures:
1. Implement automated cleanup.
2. Add validation logic.
3. Review reservation table periodically.
4. Provide user training.
Knowledge Object:
KB article  KB0030415.
Problem Ticket: No active problem ticket.

short_description: iSell's inability to access OneDrive
description:
We occasionally need iSell for kitchen planning, where nKP has broken down the dimension chains of Perso panels. Unfortunately, this means we can't attach an assembly file. Since iSell doesn't have access to OneDrive on every computer at all times, we're resorting to hammer, tablet, and chisel. Please be so kind as to enable the entire HFB 7 in store 223 for this purpose to avoid assembly interruptions and potential data privacy issues. We have the following devices on the planning area: RETDE223-WS0033 // RETDE223-WS0112 // RETDE223-WS0028 // RETDE223-WS0025 // RETDE223-WS0027 // RETDE223-WS0035 // RETDE223-WS0051 // RETDE223-WS0021 // RETDE223-WS0022. Whether we have OneDrive access is currently a daily lottery. One day it works perfectly, the next day it doesn't. One day it works on computers X and Z, the next only on Y, and the day after that, nowhere at all. For inquiries, please call or stop by. 

Variables:
-------------
Requested by: Tobias Rohn

Requested for: Tugce Oflazoglu

Stay up to date: Ivannah Jiaziella de Omaña, Severin Mai, Daniel Vengadasalam, Stefan Deimel

Title: iSell's lack of access to OneDrive

Description: We occasionally need iSell for kitchen designs where nKP has broken down the dimension chains of Perso panels. Unfortunately, this means we can't attach an assembly file. Since iSell doesn't have access to OneDrive on every computer at all times, we're resorting to hammer, tablet, and chisel. Please be so kind as to enable the entire HFB 7 in store 223 for this purpose, in order to avoid assembly interruptions and potential data protection issues. We have the following devices on the planning area: RETDE223-WS0033 // RETDE223-WS0112 // RETDE223-WS0028 // RETDE223-WS0025 // RETDE223-WS0027 // RETDE223-WS0035 // RETDE223-WS0051 // RETDE223-WS0021 // RETDE223-WS0022. Whether we have access to OneDrive is currently a daily lottery. One day it works perfectly, the next day it doesn't. One day it works on computers X and Z, the next only on Y, and the day after that nowhere at all. Please feel free to call or stop by if you have any questions. 

Impact: My team (the problem affects several people I work with) 

Urgency: Important, but can continue working
resolution_notes:
Issue Description: iSell's inability to access OneDrive
Resolution note: Please inform the user to access SAMS from the published desktop^ in citrix rather than the published app. As the one drive is suppose to work from the published desktop only without any issues.

short_description: iSell/ ISOM transmits incorrect/no billing address to RIMS
description:
If we book an ISOM order and change the delivery address there (enter a different one than the billing address or the preset delivery address), the entry is overwritten when the RIMS invoice is created and the address stored in the system is used. 
This is incorrect from an accounting perspective - this is at least the second instance; we have already reported this (and it was ignored!) 
Currently CU9162758 - customer Best Drive Austria GmbH 
 order number 1557121567 
Delivery address according to order: Landstraße 111, 6971 Hard/ Vorarlberg 
Delivery address on invoice is the same as the billing address

Variables:
-------------
Requested by: Maria Streb

Requested for: Maria Streb

Stay up to date: Markus Zechner, Alexander Nemeth, Pawel Fyda, Karin Nedbal

Title: iSell/ ISOM transmits incorrect/no billing address to RIMS

Description: When we book an ISOM order and change the delivery address there (If a different address is entered than the billing address or the preset delivery address), the entry is overwritten during RIMS invoice creation, and the address stored in the system is displayed. 
However, this is incorrect from an accounting perspective - this is at least the second instance; we have already reported this (and it was ignored!). 
Currently CU9162758 - customer BestDrive Austria GmbH 
 order number 1557121567 
Delivery address according to order: Landstraße 111, 6971 Hard/ Vorarlberg 
Delivery address on invoice is the same as the billing address

Impact: Company-wide (problem affects many users or locations)

Urgency: Important, but can continue working
resolution_notes:
Issue: iSell/ ISOM transmits incorrect/no billing address to RIMS

Workaround: The concerned team has worked on the ticket and provided an update that they have already corrected.

Confirmation: Since the concerned team has provided a workaround for this issue, I have marked the ticket as resolved.

resolution_notes:
After checking the problematic PC, I found that two of its USB ports were no longer usable.
In addition, the maintenance period for the PC itself had already expired, so I set up a new PC with a valid maintenance period and replaced the problematic one.
We confirmed together that the new PC is working properly, so this case is now considered resolved.
Thank you.
